intro: Fadogia tetraquetra, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including grasslands and forest edges. Its seeds are encased in a hairy, woody capsule that splits open when mature. Fadogia tetraquetra is also known for its potential medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
